Corrected strategy behavior

Before, it was trying to cache nodes as a proportion of nodes available
for caching, and not as a porportion of unprovisioned nodes, which is
the correct behavior.

Added ability to dynamically load a Strategy

Added functionality to dynamically load and return a configured
Strategy object.

Added exceptions to raise if importing and instantiating the strategy
object goes wrong.

Added Scout class to retrieve data from Ironic and Nova

Scout will retrieve data from Ironic and Nova, and convert the data to
forms easily consumable by strategy objects.

Also added some periodic tasks to the scheduler to retrieve data using
Scout.

Refactored client wrappers

Now wrapped clients will derive from OpenstackClientWrapper, which
provides client caching, and call retrying.

Adapted NovaClientWrapper and IronicClientWrapper to use
OpenstackClientWrapper.

Updated tests to reflect the new reality.

Updated novaclient requirement to use 2.22.0.

Adding glance client to requirements and a glance client wrapper

Adds a requirement for the glance client, as well as a wrapper for it,
and appropriate tests.

Clean up some cruft

This commit removes lots of OpenStack cruft that was pulled in via
cookiecutter or whatever.

A big fat commit

Please forgive me. I'm going add a bunch of things in one commit.

- Fixed startup so configuration file is loaded before director module
        is loaded at director startup.
- Added utility module to arsenal.common
- Added LoadClass which provides a somewhat simple way to load a module
        and class for instantiation dynamically.
- Made the Scout class abstract.
- Create an OnMetalScout class which scouts specifically for OnMetal.
        May need to abstract some of the functionality upwards out of
        OnMetalScout so it's easier to reuse in other scouts.
- Updated DirectorScheduler class to load configured scout class using
        LoadClass.
- DirectorScheduler now supports a dry run feature, where it will
        gather information and get directives from the configured
        strategy, but not execute any of the actions/directives.
- DirectorScheduler supports configurable spacing for issuing
        directives and gathering information.
- Added checksum field to ImageInput in arsenal.strategy.base
- Added flavor name field to NodeInput in arsenal.strategy.base
- Added requirement on pyrax because glanceclient :(
        I want to fix this dependency on pyrax asap.
- Minor things I'm forgetting.

The upside is this commit brings Arsenal within the realm of minimum
viable product, which is exciting. Definitely needs more testing
though. Especially against Ironic with my agent caching patch.

Changes after testing against DevStack

Apologies again for a somewhat unfocused commit.

* Added a DevStack scout which should work for testing Aresnal in
        DevStack using the example agent driver Ironic DevStack configuration.
* A few small tweaks to OnMetalScout which solves issues found in
         testing.
* Small change to the DirectorScheduler to tie updating Ironic node
        state to generating strategy directives.
* Made the SimpleProportionalStrategy percentage a configuration option
        instead of a class argument.
* Change SimpleProportionalStrategy behavior to not try to
        cache 'fractional' nodes in order to meet or exceed the
        percentage directive. This avoids behavior where Arsenal will
        always cache the last unprovisioned node in order to meet its
        caching goal, in exchange for not always strictly meeting the
        caching goal.
* Updated SimpleProportionalStrategy tests to match behavior.
* Added an example arsenal configuration file.

Closes #22

Handle time going backwards in RateLimiter

Adds test case and some code to handle the case where system time is
set to a time before the current limit period starts. Seeing how its an
unlikely/uncommon case, the best way to handle seems to be just
starting a new limit period. Otherwise the limit period could stretch
on for a very long time.

Sometime repeatedly turning back the clock would break the rate limit
behavior, but you've got bigger problems if that's happening imho.

Fix eject node behavior in OnMetalScout

Instead of setting an available node to 'deleted', we now first
send the node to 'manage', and then 'provide' which will send the node
through cleaning, thus removing the cached image and reseting the state
of the machine to before it was cached.

Fix for image cache weights configuration

Restructures image weights to load from a file containing a single JSON
object rather than trying to stuff a big dictionary into a single
configuration option.

image_weights_filename.

Changes functional tests a bit to leave more artifacts behind and
gracefully shutdown sub-processes to give them a chance to complete
rather than brutally killing them, but only if you disable test file
removal in tearDown first. Also changes functional tests to integrate
the fact that image weights have their own file now.

Fix Functional Tests

Arsenal was not receiving onmetal flavors from mimic, because the
region was not set properly. Currently mimic only returns onmetal
flavors for IAD, which reflects the current reality but will change in
the future.

Also fix a subtle unit test error for onmetal scout.

Prepare Arsenal for OnMetal V2

Refactors Scout classes a bit. Now most Openstack-related Scout functionality
is in OpenstackScout, which derives from Scout.

OnMetalScout is now OnMetalV1Scout, which derives from OpenstackScout.
DevstackScout now derives from OpenstackScout instead of from
OnMetalScout.

Adds OnMetalV2Scout which also derives from OpenstackScout.

Each of (OnMetalV1Scout, OnMetalV2Scout, DevstackScout) all construct
OpenstackScout with filtration functions to serve their specific needs.

Updates unit and functional tests for these changes.

Updates docs.
Fixup OnMetal KNOWN_V2_FLAVORS to match what Ironic reports

And some fixes to said code.

Bypasses #77.

Fix a minor bug when there are no flavor_classes for a glance image

And modified a unit test to cover this issue.

Fix how the nova client is instantiated by NovaClientWrapper

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1493576 for why the old way
was wrong.

Removes support for giving NovaClientWrapper an auth token directly,
but since that's not used in production, nothing was lost, and much was
gained.

Refuse to consult strategy or issue directives if no data

Refactors code from SimpleProportionalStrategy into the
SchedulerDirector class, since if data is missing the scheduler should
treat that as an error condition and refuse to invoke the strategy or
issue directives.

It feels more appropriate for this code to live in the scheduler rather
than a specific strategy.

Includes a unit test and unit/functional test refactoring to accomodate
changes.

I think functional tests will be fixed in Travis

since I changed the log message functional tests look for to be at the
end of 'issue_directives' in the scheduler.

Was picking up v2 flavors, this should be restrictive enough to only
grab v1 flavor names.
